channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Follow along for all the action from the fashions to the final winner on our 2021 Brownlow Medal live blog.
item.title: LIVE Brownlow 2021 - Wines’ come-from-behind Brownlow triumph with 36 votes

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Scott Morrison says France should have known Australia may have ditched its $90 billion sub deal, while France has accused Australia of treachery.
item.title: ‘Deep and grave concerns’: French should have seen sub decision coming, PM says

item.dc:creator: Damien Woolnough
item.description: AFL’s annual best and fairest awards benefited from a reboot with greater national input. Cue less same-same sexy, and more understated elegance.
item.title: An elevated Brownlow red carpet takes an exciting turn

item.description: Some discipline required for the tin eared.
item.title: Two fingered salutes to the whistling police

item.description: It's a Brownlow red carpet divided across cities but the common theme is glamour
item.title: Brownlow 2021: All the looks from the red carpet

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: Both states are charting the path to COVID-normal, but each state has differed on what freedoms it would reward its fully vaccinated residents from that first milestone of 70 per cent second dose vaccine coverage.
item.title: Victoria v New South Wales: How does the road map differ

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Retailers want details of how the road map’s vaccine mandates can be enforced, while publicans are ‘gutted’ by how long it will take to reopen.
item.title: ‘Going to be very difficult’: Business disappointed at slow road ahead

item.description: An Australian man and his Thai wife sentenced to death for trafficking half a tonne of crystal methylamphetamine for the Hells Angels have been acquitted after four years in a Bangkok jail.
item.title: Australian on Thai death row for smuggling half a tonne of crystal meth released

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: Nathan Cleary and Ryan Papenhuyzen say players milk penalties for dangerous contact because it works after Blake Ferguson bluffed officials in the semi-final against the Panthers.
item.title: Milking penalties could decide grand final, stars admit

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Foxtel will unveil its third streaming service, news-based Flash, ahead of its inaugural strategy day in October.
item.title: Foxtel prepares for launch of third streaming service ahead of investor strategy pitch

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: Clarko aside, Steven King and Adem Yze are both assistants at teams playing the AFL grand final and both have been largely overlooked so far in discussions of the Blues job.
item.title: Four Points: the grand final assistants who could coach Carlton, ditch the bye, Tigers’ smart call

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: As careful as the road map is, this level of reopening will allow the virus to spread, the modelling says, and the toll of new cases, hospitalisations and deaths comes with it.
item.title: Dark days lie ahead despite Andrews’ slow COVID reopening

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: The move marks a major step towards Australia quest to eliminate the virus, which can cause severe liver damage.
item.title: Rapid hepatitis testing to be rolled out at dozens of sites nationwide

item.description: Strata communities cannot understand their risk profile unless the state government and NSW Health share more information about positive cases of COVID-19
item.title: COVID secrecy could spell disaster for apartment residents

item.description: Australia’s description of Taiwan last week as a “critical partner” marks a significant shift in language, one that will not have gone unnoticed in Beijing.
item.title: Successful deterrence: Why AUKUS is good news for Taiwan

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: After missing friends, sport and face-to-face chats with teachers, students start to head back to class next month.
item.title: ‘We’re all quite excited’: relief as kids head back to school

item.description: Harry Brooke was all dressed up for his first day at work - which should have been in a city office. The 21-year-old tells what it was like beginning his first career job in lockdown.
item.title: What it is like starting your first job - from your spare room

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: Christian Porter has resigned as a minister after he accepted money from unknown sources through a trust arrangement for his legal battle against the ABC.
item.title: Porter saves Coalition from difficult byelection after resigning from cabinet

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: The Australian Medical Association has cautiously backed the national plan for reopening, Victoria will release its re-opening plan and NSW has eased outdoor recreation restrictions for people in hotspot LGAs
item.title: As it happened: Christian Porter resigns from federal cabinet; Victoria releases COVID-19 road map, NSW eases rules for hotspot LGAs

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: The Burnet’s modelling predicts a first peak in daily average infections of between 1400 and 2900 in the last two weeks of October. In a quarter of simulations, hospital capacity is exceeded despite Melbourne being in lockdown.
item.title: Hospitals likely overwhelmed, road map modelling shows

item.dc:creator: Colin Rubenstein
item.description: The Middle East, so often in the news for its problems, has, during the past year, pioneered a major historic breakthrough likely to have enduring effects, in the form of the Abraham Accords.
item.title: A year into the Abraham Accords shines a light into future

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Platypuses are so elusive that the location of all their different habitats remains a secret, but new technology may be about to change that.
item.title: Platypus detectives use crime scene technology to unlock monotreme mysteries

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: The education department is preparing COVID-19 mitigation measures for when school resumes but public school classrooms will not be fitted with air purifiers or carbon dioxide monitors despite them being part of the plan in Victoria.
item.title: ‘We have to be realistic’: Temporary COVID school closures to remain

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Sydney’s hotspot areas will be given the same freedoms of the rest of the city as vaccination rates rise.
item.title: All schools in greater Sydney to start staggered return on October 25

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: The Penrith trainer hauled over the coals for an incident earlier in the year is now under investigation by the NRL. He wasn’t even on the field at the time.
item.title: Strike two: Panthers trainer who stopped play against Eels warned before

item.dc:creator: Sam McClure
item.description: Melbourne Demons small forward Charlie Spargo will be available for the AFL grand final in Perth next week after surviving an injury scare at training.
item.title: Demons declare Spargo fit for grand final

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: For the PM, for Porter to stay was untenable because it would have redefined the standards for ministers in a way that would have opened a Pandora’s box of secret deals.
item.title: Standards are higher for ministers: Why Porter had to resign

item.dc:creator: Sharon Lewin
item.description: There is a road out of this – a long, slow and at times bumpy one to be sure. But we are heading in the right direction.
item.title: Victoria’s roadmap to reopening will see our hard work pay off

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Queensland schools are being urged to sign up for a new citizen science program in which children will collect insects to help discover new species.
item.title: Calling all schools, scientists need your help to find missing insects

item.dc:creator: Cameron Gooley
item.description: New emails reveal a major reason why a water resource plan for a NSW river wasn’t accredited was because of inadequate consultation with Aboriginal people.
item.title: Water talks latest in Aboriginal consultation bungles by NSW government

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: A new research hub led by the University of Queensland will use the money to study evidence-based rehab treatments.
item.title: $2.5m funding injection to better help those with drug and alcohol addictions

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: Victorians will find it jarring that NSW will gain significant freedoms about a month earlier than them under the Premier’s reopening plan.
item.title: Andrews walks tightrope in agonisingly slow path to freedom

item.description: Black ties were out, replaced by a relaxed vibe more conducive to the AFL hubs spread across the country.
item.title: Brownlow 2020: All the looks from the red carpet

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Racing NSW chief executive Peter V’landys believes the use of quick antigen COVID testing has been key to keeping racing’s participants safe through the pandemic.
item.title: Golden Rose to stay at Rosehill as COVID protocols tighten

item.description: The seven-race program at Grafton on Monday kicks off with the maiden sprinters at set weights.
item.title: Tips and race-by-race preview for Grafton on Monday

item.dc:creator: Tony Blakely
item.description: Victoria’s roadmap looks to be a sensible balance of cautious opening up and trying to keep within the principles of the national plan for reopening.
item.title: Roadmap takes us on a Victorian rollercoaster to Christmas

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: Online customers (and curious home-cooks) are swapping and sharing discount codes as demand for easier dinner options grows during lockdown.
item.title: Ready, steady, cook: customers swap meal kits, discounts in pursuit of dinner excitement

item.dc:creator: Sherryn Groch
item.description: As Russians go to the polls for one of the least free elections in years, how does their nation’s political system (and Putin’s empire) work?
item.title: Russia votes, no big surprises: How does Putin’s ‘vertical of power’ work?

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: Brandon Smith thought his season was over. But he has made a remarkable recovery as Josh Addo-Carr also firms for a preliminary final return against Penrith.
item.title: ‘I had a little cry’: the moment Melbourne’s larrikin broke down in tears

item.dc:creator: Daniel Brettig
item.description: Ellyse Perry believes the success of The Hundred and the WBBL should encourage India’s board to launch a full women’s IPL.
item.title: ‘Next frontier’: Perry wants India to ‘pull trigger’ on full women’s IPL

item.dc:creator: Ashleigh McMillan
item.description: The Age photographer Luis Ascui was hit with capsicum spray by police at an anti-lockdown rally on Saturday, with a complaint to be lodged with Victoria Police.
item.title: Age photographer capsicum sprayed by police during protest

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: The federal government’s latest appointment to the commission has generated a huge storm of controversy, but Lorraine Finlay’s defenders say she is a classical liberal who will be no government patsy.
item.title: Free speech, consent, COVID-19: Busy times for the new Human Rights Commissioner

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: The long Sydney lockdown has produced a strange paradox where house prices have risen even as the economy struggles.
item.title: Rising house prices offers NSW a recovery opportunity

item.dc:creator: Josh Dye
item.description: The NSW government has tipped in $200,000 to a pilot program pairing elderly homeowners who live alone with young people struggling with housing affordability.
item.title: ‘It’s a win-win’: Home sharing scheme helps the elderly and young

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Argentina managed two draws against Australia last year but coach Mario Ledesma insists this Wallabies team is vastly improved ahead of Saturday’s clash in Townsville.
item.title: ‘We’re playing a different beast’: Ledesma wary of Kerevi and Wallabies

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: The Manly young gun was reportedly agitating for a move back to the halves before Kieran Foran’s return to the Sea Eagles. But he’s happy to be a destructive back-rower for years to come.
item.title: Has Josh Schuster found his home in the back row?

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Ant Middleton is known for his tough exterior and saying it how it is. But there is one vice he just can’t give up.
item.title: SAS’ Ant Middleton reveals the alternative career he always wanted

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: The AUKUS defence pact is unlikely to have a material impact on iron ore prices in the short-term, investors say, but warned of longer-term risks of pinning the country’s defence strategy to the US.
item.title: ‘Getting punched in the face’: Investors brace for iron ore falls as China tensions linger

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: Vaccines could become mandatory for all Victoria’s authorised workers, teachers, childcare workers, parents of childcare workers, hospitality staff and hospitality patrons as the state moves to reopen schools and businesses.
item.title: ‘Home stretch’: Government reveals road map out of lockdown, shuts down large slices of public life to the unvaccinated

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Gold Coast are eyeing former Geelong captain and current Western Bulldogs assistant coach Steven King to provide further support for senior coach Stuart Dew.
item.title: Suns eye Bulldogs assistant King
